Author: ravenslofty
Content:
Most likely not; opensta can use the power information from the liberty file and *guess* what the power usage would be, but for meaningful real-world numbers you would need to give opensta a VCD or something that contains a realistic trace of what you're going to run. 

Even so, it will probably barely tickle an ammeter, so don't worry too much.

Author: logic_anarchy
Content: As a rough upper bound, can we assume a worst case where all transistors toggle every clock cycle?

Author: mithro_
Content: @Lofty - That was my assumption too, but @Tholin seem to indicate their GF180MCU chips got pretty warm to the touch.

Content: At 50MHz, the AS2650v2 gets hot enough to hurt
